summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel and Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding the logistics of shipping approximately 23 boxes of case records from FBI case files 72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062 to Virginia for scanning. The prosecutors identify themselves as working on the investigation and provide contact information.

persons.name: SSA
persons.context: FBI Supervisory Special Agent in New York coordinating the shipment of case records and inquiring about setting up a tipline with the VSs.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney from the Southern District of New York, working on the investigation, coordinating with the FBI to ship approximately 23 boxes of case records.

persons.name: Colleague
persons.context: Colleague of the Assistant U.S. Attorney, also a prosecutor working on the investigation, copied on the email chain.

connections.description: Coordinating the shipment of evidence boxes from FBI case files to Virginia for the investigation.
Both are prosecutors working together on the investigation, as indicated in the email.

events.title: Coordination for Evidence Shipment
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney sends email to FBI contact providing full contact info and confirming understanding of approximately 23 boxes of papers to be shipped.

events.title: Tipline Setup Inquiry
events.description: SSA inquires about setting up a tipline with the VSs and discusses plans for handling evidence shipment to Virginia.

keyFacts: The document references two specific FBI case files: 72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062, with approximately 23 boxes of papers total.
Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York identify themselves as prosecutors working on the investigation and are coordinating evidence transfer with the FBI.
There is discussion about setting up a tipline with the VSs (likely Victim Specialists or similar).
The evidence shipment involves approximately two boxes from case file 72-MM-113327 and the remainder from case file 31E-MM-108062.
